tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE CustomerRiskProfile (
  customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  risk_level VARCHAR(50),
  risk_score INT,
  risk_description TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE customers (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(50),
  email VARCHAR(50),
  risk_profile VARCHAR(20)
)

CREATE TABLE high_risk_customers (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  risk_score INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(id)
)

CREATE TABLE medium_risk_customers (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  risk_score INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(id)
)

CREATE TABLE low_risk_customers (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  risk_score INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(id)
)

CREATE TABLE customers (
	customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	customer_name VARCHAR(50),
	risk_profile VARCHAR(20),
	contact_info VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE high_risk_customers (
	customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	risk_factor INT,
	classification VARCHAR(20)
)

CREATE TABLE medium_risk_customers (
	customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	risk_factor INT,
	classification VARCHAR(20)
)

CREATE TABLE low_risk_customers (
	customer_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	risk_factor INT,
	classification VARCHAR(20)
)

CREATE TABLE marketing_strategies (
	strategy_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	strategy_name VARCHAR(50),
	target_audience VARCHAR(50),
	description TEXT
)
